## Interactive Visualization Examples

Here are some examples of interactive data visualizations.

### Example 1: Interactive Scatter Plot

```{python}
#| echo: true
import plotly.express as px
import pandas as pd

# Create sample data
df = pd.DataFrame({
    'x': range(1, 11),
    'y': [2, 4, 5, 4, 6, 7, 8, 7, 9, 10],
    'category': ['A', 'B', 'A', 'B', 'A', 'B', 'A', 'B', 'A', 'B']
})

# Create interactive scatter plot
fig = px.scatter(df, x='x', y='y', color='category',
                 title='Interactive Scatter Plot',
                 labels={'x': 'X Value', 'y': 'Y Value'})
fig.show()
```

### Example 2: Bar Chart

```{python}
#| echo: true
import plotly.express as px

# Sample data
data = {
    'Month': ['Jan', 'Feb', 'Mar', 'Apr', 'May', 'Jun'],
    'Sales': [120, 150, 180, 170, 200, 220]
}
df = pd.DataFrame(data)

# Create bar chart
fig = px.bar(df, x='Month', y='Sales',
             title='Monthly Sales',
             color='Sales',
             color_continuous_scale='Blues')
fig.show()
```

### Example 3: Line Chart with Multiple Series

```{python}
#| echo: true
import plotly.graph_objects as go
import numpy as np

# Generate data
x = np.linspace(0, 10, 100)
y1 = np.sin(x)
y2 = np.cos(x)

# Create figure
fig = go.Figure()
fig.add_trace(go.Scatter(x=x, y=y1, mode='lines', name='sin(x)'))
fig.add_trace(go.Scatter(x=x, y=y2, mode='lines', name='cos(x)'))

fig.update_layout(
    title='Trigonometric Functions',
    xaxis_title='X',
    yaxis_title='Y'
)
fig.show()
```
